meanings.definition: Cut off (a branch or limb) from a tree or plant.
meanings.sent1: She lopped the overgrown branches from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The gardener lopped off the dead limb to help the tree grow better.
meanings.sent3: The tree felt relieved after getting lopped and could finally breathe.
meanings.sent4: With each branch lopped, the tree seemed to stand taller and prouder.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the branches being lopped echoed through the forest.

meanings.definition: Trim off (something) from a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: He lopped a piece of fabric from the edge of the cloth.
meanings.sent2: The tailor lopped off the excess material to make the dress fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The shirt looked surprised after having a piece lopped off unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: She lopped away the unnecessary details, leaving only the essence of the story.
meanings.sent5: The cake looked much better with the extra frosting lopped off the top.
